The 'blesbok' or 'blesbuck' (Damaliscus pygargus phillipsi) is an antelope
endemic to South Africa. It has a distinctive white face and forehead which
inspired the name, because bles is the Afrikaans word for a such as one might
see on the forehead of a horse.
